title: test(hardfork): test if the B extension feature is correct
body:
### Purpose

At present, there is no tests for B extension.

Limited by the lack of tools, the test coverage for the whole B extension is dependent on `ckb-vm`.

In this PR, only add very simple tests with a very simple B extension instruction [`cpop`](https://github.com/riscv/riscv-bitmanip/blob/1.0.0/bitmanip/_popcount.adoc), to test if the B extension feature is correct:

```
|     Run Script with B-Ext Insts      |
|--------------------------------------|
|         |       |    B-Ext Insts     |
|         |       |---------+----------|
| Edition | Type  |         | Executed |
|         |       | Skipped |----------|
|         |       |         | OK | Err |
|---------+-------|---------+----+-----|
| ckb2019 | Data  |    O    | R  |  R  |
|         | Type  |    O    | R  |  R  |
|---------+-------+---------+----+-----|
|         | Data  |    O    | R  |  R  |
| ckb2021 | Type  |    O    | O  |  X  |
|         | Data1 |    O    | O  |  X  |
```

Description of the table as above:
- Skipped: the script has B extension instructions but not executed.
- Executed: the script has B extension instructions but executed.
  - OK: if all instructions are executed as them defined, the script should be passed.
  - Err: if all instructions are executed as them defined, the script should be failed.
- Result:
  - `O`: Passed.
  - `X`: Failed, the VM returns `ValidationFailure`.
  - `R`: Reject, the VM returns `InvalidInstruction`.

title: fix: fix the status marking problem of header sync
body:
There has always been a problem with the header sync protocol. When only the sync protocol is enabled, there may be a relatively large delay in obtaining the latest block. This is caused by incorrect state marking. This PR introduces a new state. Try to fix this problem.

The action of header sync is not completed at one time. It needs to be updated in real-time during the entire connection process. It cannot be considered that this node is always at the highest just because it is synchronized to the highest one time. That is to say, the completed state of sync should be dynamically converted to need sync again. 

The `TipSynced` status indicates that this node has synchronized the headers and will try to synchronize again after 28s. At the same time, such a node can be used as the request object of `Getblocks`

`Suspend` and `TipSynced` are not exactly the same. Suspend thinks that the node may have some problems, such as being in the ibd state and suspending the sync request to it. Such a node cannot be used as the request object of the sync block, and it does not need to be based on the frequency of the block time to detection status

title: fix(hardfork): the spec hash for mainnet and testnet should be same as before
body:
Fix #2834. ### Brief Explanation of the Reason The order of fields in `Script` was changed, so the serialized data was changed, then the hash of spec data was changed.
See the differences. - In CKB v0.43.0, `Script` is: https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/bbbe5a58f7024f1157fba75f26ab4e2fdfee1e38/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L75-L82 - In CKB 0.100.0-rc1, `Script` is https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/c472ca3a924152c1a82adb0810ba5afa09548c79/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L80-L87
### Details about How it Happened In the next hardfork, CKB 2021, a new version of CKB VM will be introduced, so we have to change the `hash_type` in `Script`. - In my first solution, the spec hash wasn't changed.
I just added an optional field vm_version and skipped serialization when its value was 0. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/e4dac8a043e9fd240c0afc90f594b6413e97bca0/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L20-L29
- Then, according to the review suggestions, I changed the `hash_type` from `String` to `Object`.
In this solution, the spec hash was changed since the serialized data was changed. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/40b449792f17acd23f910233f502991b6843da16/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L27-L35
So I introduced a new filed edition to keep the compatibility. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/40b449792f17acd23f910233f502991b6843da16/spec/src/lib.rs#L451-L460
Worse still, we had to face to an already known bug. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/40b449792f17acd23f910233f502991b6843da16/spec/src/lib.rs#L9-L11
I had no choice, except to change the order of fields. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/40b449792f17acd23f910233f502991b6843da16/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L157-L164
- Things are volatile. Almost the last days before we released the rc1, new opinion said the `hash_type` should be an enumeration type as the same as before.
Then I changed it back to an enumeration type. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/4aadeb90f552532cf93834f954e0c259b2a2ce6b/util/jsonrpc-types/src/blockchain.rs#L20-L27
After that, I reverted the design of `edition` according to the result of a new discussion, and used the new compatibility policy for configuration files to instead of it. https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/blob/8d1301d074e19a5dee8974d575e81d70adde414f/spec/src/lib.rs#L452-L461
The spec should be changed back to the original value since we decided to revert a compatible design. But I didn't recall this incident. So, the bug was introduced. ### Affected Version Only 0.100.0-rc1.
